@@ -0,0 +1,8 @@
+# This private feature corresponds to using a JSF-providing feature
+# with just a container and no implementation (e.g. jsfContainer-3.0)
+-include= ~${workspace}/cnf/resources/bnd/feature.props
+symbolicName=io.openliberty.facesProvider-3.0.0.Container
+singleton=true
+visibility=private
+kind=noship
+edition=core

nodes.bodyText: Is this something new added to the latest jakarta CDI/Faces?

These files were out of date, so I updated them as part of this new feature. I can undo these changes, and do them in a separate PR if you still want these updates.  (Or I can just create a new issue and link this PR to it).
You can find these files here: https://github.com/weld/core/tree/master/modules/jsf/src/main/java/org/jboss/weld/module/jsf
This particular change you commented on was part of WELD-2512 if you look at the commit history.
Correct to classloading30

nodes.bodyText: Might not need the if statement if it's run after each test
Saw these in other tests, so I thought it should be there too?
The isStarted() isn't completely necessary since stopServer() checks that, but it doesn't hurt
I'll just keep it for consistency
I don't think you need to add this - the app that's used for this test - JSFApplication - invokes server.addInstalledAppForValidation(), which should this case a bit more robustly
i had trouble without that line before, but things seem to work even with it removed removed
remove jpa-3.0 as the name has changed

I do understand why this class exists here but we should a) compare it to the most recent Weld 4.0 version and b) see if the Weld guys would be willing to make changes if we need them.
